724796f-b.title: Manhattan: William Street - John Street
724796f-b.text:
(1)
William Street, west side, north from (No. 101) and including John
Street, showing workmen constructing three additional stories to a 6-
story office building, Nos. 111-121 William Street, at the N.W. corner of
John Street. On the opposite corner (S.W.) appears excavation for the
foundation for the new 30-story New Amsterdam Casualty Building.
July 7, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A portion of the same, viewing slightly westward and showing a part
of the John Street side of the building that is being enlarged. Adjoin-
ing it is the 16-story Travelers lInsurance Co. Building, No. 51-55
John Street, at the N.E. corner of Dutch Street. In the background is
visible the tower of the Woolworth Building.
July 7, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724796f-b.folder: William Street & John Street, Manhattan, NY

724801f.title: Manhattan: William Street - John Street
724801f.text:
William Street, south from John Street. On the left is Platt
Street. Progressively thru the view appearing are Maiden Lane,
Liberty and Cedar Streets.
1938-9
Alexander Alland
NO REPRODUCTIONS
This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume
''Portrait of N. Y.' by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.
724801f.folder: William Street & John Street, Manhattan, NY

724800f-a.title: Manhattan: William Street - John Street
724800f-a.text:
118-122 William Street, east side, north of JJohn Street.
May 27, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724800f-a.folder: William Street & John Street, Manhattan, NY

724797f-a.title: Manhattan: William Street - John Street
724797f-a.text:
106-98 William Street, east side, south from John (left) to Platt
(right, not shown) Streets, showing the 13-story Woodbridge Building with
its 17-story annex (76-78 John Street). Excavation shown at the S.W. corner
is for the 30-story New Amsterdam Casualty Co Building.
July 7, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724797f-a.folder: William Street & John Street, Manhattan, NY

724802f-a.title: Manhattan: William Street - John Street
724802f-a.text:
No. 134 William Street, east side, between John and Fulton Streets.
About 1912.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

1508625-a.title: William Street #100 - John Street - Platt Street, east side
1508625-a.folder: William Street #100 - John Street - Platt Street, east side, Manhattan, NY

724798f-a.title: Manhattan: William Street - John Street
724798f-a.text:
110 to 12O William Street, at, adjoining and north of the N.E. corner
of John Street, showing houses (Nos. 110 to 116) being razed to make room
for a 20-story office building bearing Nos. l10-116 William and 6977
John Streets. On the extreme right is shown a portion of the Woodbridge
Building at the S.E. corner of John Street.
May 15, 1917.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
724798f-a.folder: William Street & John Street, Manhattan, NY

724799f-a.title: Manhattan: William Street - John Street
724799f-a.text:
110-114, 118 and 120 William Street (right to left) at, adioining and
north of the N.E. corner of John Street. The 9-story structure (No. 120)
appearing on the left, stands upon the former site of The Rigging House
which was the first place fitted up for Methodist worship in New York.
Services were held in this building between 1766-1788. For a lithograph
of same, see, D.T. Valentine's Manual.
About 1915.
Edwin Levick.
NO RDPPODUCTIONS.
724799f-a.folder: William Street & John Street, Manhattan, NY
